intro: Cordia lucayana, commonly known as the Lucayan cordia, is a small evergreen tree native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are often used in local traditional medicine. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable in some regions.
